page.title: 18The Norwich Southern By-pass
page.content: A more{definite route}has now been established, leaving the{old A47, which passes through the village just beyond{St. Peter's church,}coming through Easton lodge estate, along the south side of the{Longwater gravel {pits,}crossing the A47 at the new {roundabout}on the Norwich side of the {Royal Norfolk Showground. { { Environmental problems}in the stretch between the{A47 and Colney}have been lessened by the new line. It still affects a wooded area called{Beech {Plantation,}but this could be avoided by a relatively slight realignment as could some{mature woodland}between Easton and Costessey.
